channel.title: Bash on Claire Parker-Jones Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Bash on Claire Parker-Jones Blog

item.title: Command concatenation in the terminal
item.description: You may know that you can chain commands at the terminal. So instead of writing $ echo 'foo' $ echo 'bar' And hitting return after each one, you could type: $ echo 'foo' && echo 'bar' And achieve much the same thing - not exactly the same output but often close enough. I frequently use this combination in my JavaScript app development: rm -rf node_modules && npm i && say done That’s a freebie.
